Dear Ms. Prudhomme:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a corrective action plan is required. The corrective action
plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter, must be completed and routed in CWLM,
and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (517) 243-9743.
Sincerely,
Barbara A Cote, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109 Program statement.
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents' needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On an unknown date, a staff member provided a youth with
marijuana.
Investigation Complainant was interviewed via telephone on April 14, 2025,
and reported Youth A provided three different stories as to
where she got the marijuana. Complainant reported Youth A
stated she brought back the marijuana from a home pass,
received the marijuana from a former staff member and stated she
received it from a current staff member.
Director of Residential was interviewed face to face at the
facility on April 16, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker.
Director of Residential reported often when Youth A returns from a
home pass, staff have found vapes and Youth A tests positive for
marijuana. Director of Residential stated Youth A reported Staff 6
provided marijuana to Youth A. Director of Residential reported
Staff 6 quit on April 3, 2025, and never worked in Sherk house
with Youth A.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on April
16, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth B
described marijuana being found at Sherk house about one week
ago by staff. Youth B reported the marijuana was brought back
from a home pass by a youth. Youth B stated she would not
provide the name of the youth because that would be a “snitch.”
Youth B denied any marijuana currently being at the house.
Youth B reported Staff 3 and Staff 6 at different times have
provided marijuana to youth at the facility. Youth B stated Staff 6
provided marijuana to some of the boys, Youth B did not know
which boys, at the facility (being investigated in
2025SIC0000566). Youth B denied seeing Staff 6 provide
marijuana to the boys but heard it occurred. Youth B described
2

asking Staff 3 to bring in marijuana and Staff 3 did so “months
ago.” Youth B reported Staff 3 gave her a small Ziplock bag that
contained nuggets of marijuana. Youth B stated Staff 3 will take
youth on walks and allow the youth to vape. Youth B would not
provide any youths’ names who were provided marijuana or
vapes.
Youth B reported staff search youth and their belongings when
returning from a home pass and youths’ bedrooms. Youth B
stated that sometimes vapes are found by staff. Youth B
described youth hiding marijuana and lighters in the woods and
will smoke when youth AWOL. Youth B denied knowing who is
hiding the items or where the items are hidden.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on April
16, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth A reported
marijuana was found about one week ago at the house in the
hallway outside her bedroom. Youth A stated the marijuana was
provided by Staff 6 , who no longer works at the facility. Youth A
denied the marijuana belonged to her. Youth A denied ever
bringing any marijuana or vape pens back to the facility after
home passes. Youth A reported Staff 3 provided marijuana to two
of the boys, Youth H and Youth I (being investigated in
2025SIC0000566). Youth A stated she was not aware when that
occurred. Youth A reported she heard from youth, would not say
who, Staff 3 and Staff 6 are the only staff she is aware of who
have provided marijuana or vape pens to youths.
Youth A reported Staff 3 allowed Youth A and two other youth to
“hit her vape” while on a walk. Youth A described the vape pen as
a breeze pen with a cherry cola flavor. Youth A would not provide
the names of the other two youths. Youth A stated she has heard
there is marijuana hidden somewhere in the woods. Youth A
denied knowing where it is hidden or who hid the marijuana.
Youth A reported she is unaware if marijuana is currently hidden
in the woods.
Youth A described staff search youths when returning from home
passes, as well as the youths’ belongings. Youth A stated youths’
bedrooms also get searched.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on April
17, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth C denied
any staff provided her with marijuana or vape pens. Youth C
reported she heard from other youths (would not say who) Staff 6
provided Youth H and Youth I marijuana (being investigated in
3

2025SIC0000566). Youth C denied seeing any staff give any
youth marijuana or vape pens. Youth C stated staff search youth
coming back from home passes, youths’ belongings and complete
regular room searches.
Youth D was interviewed face to face at the facility on April
17, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth D denied
any staff ever provided her with marijuana or vape pens. Youth D
reported she overheard girls (would not provide names) in her
house say Staff 6 got caught giving some boys marijuana. Youth
D stated she does not know the boys very well so did not know
the boys’ names. Youth D denied seeing any staff ever provide
any youth marijuana or vape pens. Youth D reported she is
unaware how youth are getting marijuana or vape pens because
staff search youth when returning from home passes, youths’
belongings and complete regular room searches for contraband.
Youth E was interviewed face to face at the facility on April
17, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth E denied
any staff ever provided her with marijuana or vape pens. Youth E
reported she heard Staff 6 provided marijuana to some of the
boys. Youth E reported she was not going to say how she heard
or who the boys were that were provided the marijuana. Youth E
denied ever seeing any staff ever provided marijuana or vape
pens to any youth.
Youth E reported staff always search youth, youths’ belongings
when returning from a home pass. Youth E stated staff complete
regular room searches. Youth E denied knowing where the
marijuana or vape pens are coming from.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on April 17,
2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 1 denied ever
seeing any staff provide any youth marijuana or vapes. Staff 1
denied any youth ever asking him for marijuana or vapes.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on April 17,
2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 2 described
Youth A smelling of marijuana after returning from a home pass.
Staff 2 reported Youth A was searched upon returning, and no
contraband was found. Staff 2 stated Youth A walked down the
hallway toward her bedroom and sat in her doorway. Staff 2
reported Youth B and Youth D followed Youth A. Staff 2 reported
talking with Staff 4 about the youths’ behaviors, so Staff 4 went
outside, walked around the house and surprised the youth by
coming in the emergency door at the end of the hallway while
4

Staff 2 stood at the other end of the hallway/living area watching
Youth A, Youth B, and Youth D. Staff 2 stated when Staff 4
opened the emergency door, Youth A quickly went into her
bedroom and closed the door while Youth B and Youth D quickly
walked away. Staff 2 described Staff 4 finding a bag of marijuana
on the floor in front of Youth A’s door. Staff 2 reported Youth A
stated she got the marijuana when she was home but did not
provide who gave her the marijuana while home. Staff 2 stated
Youth B and Youth D reported they got the marijuana from Youth
A.
Staff 2 reported Youth F took a nicotine vape pen out of Staff 3’s
purse one time about one month ago and attempted to do so one
other time. Staff 2 stated she was not working when Youth F
successfully got the vape pen from Staff 3’s purse but was made
aware of the incident. Staff 2 reported she was working when
Youth F attempted to get into Staff 3’s purse a second time. Staff
2 described Youth A, Youth C, and Youth F going into the staff
office with another staff to get a snack then creating a distraction
as Youth F tried to get into Staff 3’s purse. Staff 2 reported she
was with the other youth in the house but was called for
assistance by Staff 7 who was with Youth A, Youth C, and Youth
F in the staff office. Staff 2 stated Youth F was not able to get
Staff 3’s vape pen. Staff 2 reported vape pens and or cigarette
are supposed to be locked in a staff’s vehicle, not brought into the
house. Staff 2 denied seeing any staff member provide any
marijuana or vape pen to any youth.
Youth F was interviewed via telephone on April 29, 2025, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker 2 who was face to face with
Youth F at a different facility. Youth F reported she was aware
Staff 3 used a nicotine vape pen because Youth F asked all the
staff if they smoked. Youth F reported while being in the back
office with Staff 3, she told Staff 3, “let me hit your vape.” Youth F
stated Staff 3 told her no, she would get in trouble but then offered
to go outside. Youth F reported Staff 3 took Youth F, Youth A,
and Youth B outside by the shed around 9-10pm and passed the
nicotine vape pen around with everyone “taking hits.” Youth F
described it as a nicotine breeze vape pen with the flavor of cherry
cola. Youth F stated they [Staff 3, Youth A, Youth B, and Youth F]
were outside for approximately five minutes. Youth F reported
trying to talk Staff 3 into giving the vape pen to her, but Staff 3
refused. Youth F stated Staff 2 was working and Youth F believed
Staff 2 suspected something was going on.
5

Youth F described trying to take the vape pen again from Staff 3’s
purse while in the office but was caught by a staff member. Youth
F denied any staff providing marijuana to her. Youth F denied
ever seeing any staff provide any youth marijuana or vapes.
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on April 30,
2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 3 described
Youth F asking to go in the backyard and talk. Staff 3 reported
she went outside with Youth F and Youth A, and Youth B also
came outside. Staff 3 stated once outside, Youth F took out Staff
3’s vape from her [Youth F] coat pocket. Staff 3 stated it was a
breeze vape cherry cola flavor. Staff 3 described trying to get the
vape back from Youth F, but she refused to give it back right
away. Staff 3 stated eventually she was successful getting it back
after Youth F, Youth A, and Youth B passed the vape. Staff 3
denied seeing Youth F take the vape from Staff 3’s purse. Staff 3
reported the vape was in her purse, in the staff office. Staff 3
stated she did not know why she did not lock her purse in her
vehicle. Staff 3 denied reporting the incident to anyone or
documenting what occurred. Staff 3 reported Youth F asked all
the staff if they smoked so Youth F was aware Staff 3 used a
nicotine vape. Staff 3 stated once Youth F knew Staff 3 vaped
Youth F asked Staff 3 for her vape and Staff 3 told her “Absolutely
not.”
Staff 3 reported she heard from staff, could not recall who, Youth I
was caught smoking marijuana when he first arrived at the facility
(being investigated in 2025SIC0000566). Staff 3 stated she was
not sure how or where Youth I got the marijuana. Staff 3 denied
ever seeing any staff provide marijuana or vapes to any youth.
Staff 3 denied providing vapes or marijuana to any youth. Staff 3
stated youth and their belongings are searched when returning
from a home pass. Staff 3 reported youths’ bedrooms are also
searched regularly for contraband.
Staff 4 was interviewed via telephone on April 30, 2025, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 4 described making
plans with Staff 2 because Youth A, Youth B, and Youth D were
acting suspiciously and Staff 2 thought they might have marijuana.
Staff 4 reported she went outside the house, walked around the
building and entered through the emergency entrance at the end
of the bedroom hallway while Staff 2 stood at the other end of the
hallway watching Youth A, Youth B, and Youth D. Staff 4 stated
when she entered the house, Youth A shut her bedroom door and
stated she was changing her clothes. Staff 4 described Youth B
and Youth D quickly backing away from Youth A’s doorway. Staff
6

4 reported finding an open baggie of marijuana residue on the
floor outside Youth A’s bedroom. Staff 4 stated Youth A, Youth B,
and Youth D all denied the marijuana was theirs. Staff 4 reported
she heard from staff, youth were trying to sneak contraband in
stuffed animals and/or in their underwear or bras, places staff are
unable to search. Staff 4 stated youth and their belongings are
searched after every home pass. Staff 4 reported regular room
searches are also completed. Staff 4 denied seeing any staff
member provide any youth with marijuana or vapes. Staff 4
denied having any suspicion of any staff providing youth with
vapes or vaping with any youth.
Staff 8 was interviewed via Teams on May 2, 2025, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 8 reported hearing
youth in the house say Staff 3 provided Youth F with a nicotine
vape. Staff 8 did not see Staff 3 give Youth F the vape but heard
Youth F took it from Staff 3’s purse. Staff 8 stated Youth F
planned on blackmailing Staff 3 to get the vape. Staff 8 reported
there was a time at the barn Staff 3 was with Youth C, Youth G
and another youth (could not recall what youth) and all of them
were acting suspicious by putting their face in their shirts and
coughing. Staff 8 denied smelling marijuana or nicotine but had
concerns that maybe Youth C and Youth G were vaping. Staff 8
stated she was with other youth, so she did not approach Staff 3,
Youth C, Youth G, and the other youth with them. Staff 8
described Staff 5 also being on shift and possibly having more
information. Staff 8 reported the incident was reported to
Supervisor (being investigated in 2025SIC0000663). Staff 8
reported she did not have any other concerns with staff providing
any other youth marijuana or vapes.
Staff 5 was interviewed via telephone on May 14, 2025. Staff 5
reported witnessing Staff 3 standing with Youth C, Youth D, and
Youth G outside by the ALC barn and it appeared Youth C was
possibly vaping because Staff 5 could see smoke coming from
Youth C’s mouth (being investigated in 2025SIC0000663). Staff 5
denied actually seeing a vape, but suspected Youth C was vaping.
Staff 5 stated this is the only time she suspected a staff member
provided a vape to a youth. Staff 5 denied ever seeing Staff 3
give a vape to any youth. Staff 5 stated she reported the incident
to Supervisor. Staff 5 denied hearing of any staff member
providing marijuana or vapes to any youth.
Video Review
Video footage of April 8, 2025, was reviewed with DHHS Worker.
The video shows Youth D standing by Youth A’s doorway and
7

Staff 2 standing in the hallway/living room area. The emergency
door (door at the end of the hallway, opposite Staff 2) opens, and
Staff 4 enters the hallway from the outside. Youth B and Youth D
quickly walk away from Youth A’s doorway toward the living room.
Youth A shuts her door and does not come out of her room. Staff
4 picks up a small baggie from the floor outside of Youth A’s door.
There is no camera footage of any other incidents described
above in the interviews.
Documents Reviewed:
• Staff 6’s personnel file: There was no discipline record.
Staff 6’s separation form: Staff 6’s last day worked
04/02/2025, employment ended 04/03/2025.
• Staff 3’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary record
and Staff 3 completed all of New Employee Orientation
training from 09/16/2024 - 09/27/2024, which would have
covered Eagle Village’s policy regarding storage of
cigarette/vapes, code of conduct with youths, etc.
• Incident Report dated 4/8/2025. Incident report is
consistent with Staff 2 and Staff 5 interviews as well as
video review.
• Eagle Village Staff Code of Conduct Policy. Policy states,
“Staff are prohibited from providing cigarette lighters,
cigarettes, vape pens, chewing tobacco, or any other
item/substance that is illegal for a minor to use or have in
their possession. If a staff uses any of these items
personally and they are brought to campus, staff shall keep
these belongings secure in a place such as locked in their
vehicles. Smoking and vaping are not allowed on our
campus.”
• Eagle Village Incident Reports Policy. Policy states, “Any
incident needing immediate response or follow-up in a short
period of time must be communicated to the On Call
Supervisor, verbally by the staff involved. The written
Incident Report-IR essentially serves as a follow-up
document of the incident. Critical incidents include but are
not limited to: unauthorized use and possession of legal,
illegal substances or intoxicants.”
Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance as per Staff 3’s interview
she did not lock her purse containing her vape pen in her vehicle.
Per Staff 3’s interview Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C took a hit
off Staff 3’s nicotine vape pen in front of Staff 3 and Staff 3 did not
tell any supervisor/administrator of the incident or document the
incident.
8

Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
2025SIC0000229 approved 2/27/25; CAP approved 3/19/25
2023SIC0000451 approved 6/28/23; CAP approved 7/25/23
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
